body: A subway worker responsible for flagging train operators to get them to slow down in a work zone was himself struck and killed by a train in Brooklyn yesterday as other members of his work crew reacted in horror. It was the first fatal accident involving a transit worker this year. The worker, identified by transit officials as Harold Dozier, 54,
title: Worker Killed by Subway on Tracks in Brooklyn

body: TAMA JANOWITZ'S new book is called ''Area Code 212: New York Days, New York Nights,'' but it is essentially about the view from Brooklyn. That's where Ms. Janowitz moved six years ago with her husband, Tim Hunt, who is the curator of the Warhol estate, and their daughter, Willow. Safe in the 718 area code, in Prospect Heights, Ms. Janowitz is
title: HABITATS/Eastern Parkway; A 'Slave of New York' Loves Brooklyn

body: A sampling of the musical presentations planned for the holiday season at churches and concert halls in New York City. All are free unless otherwise noted. (Churches accept donations.) This selection, compiled by Jeremy Eichler, represents what caught this critic's eye and excited his expectations. More holiday recommendations for this weekend are
title: 'Messiahs' Here, 'Glorias' There, Holiday Music Is Everywhere

body: Four people were shot last night as police officers and two gunmen on foot exchanged gunfire on a residential street in a quiet Brooklyn neighborhood, the police said. The two gunmen, one of whom was shot in the abdomen by the police, are under arrest. Two guns were recovered. According to witnesses, the gun battle, in which seven or more shots
title: 4 Shot in Brooklyn Gun Battle

body: There is widespread agreement among politicians in New York, where state legislators are rarely defeated once they get into office, that the best opportunity to beat an incumbent is in his or her first re-election campaign. That strategy appears to be playing out in a heated and emotional Democratic primary for the State Senate in a district
title: In Flatbush, 2 Challengers Work to Unseat a State Senator Before He Really Settles In

body: To the Editor: I couldn't help thinking that Leslie Kaufman was describing my neighborhood when she mentioned her son searching for fireflies and his makeshift workshop in the garage. Fortunately, my wife and I were able to find refuge from the city, in the city, in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn. We, too, grew up in the city, lived together in the West
title: City or Suburbs? That Is the Question
